title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.12.24 Part 1 | 29-08-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras.

segments.key_quote: This child will be almost as good as Lord Sri Krishna by following in his footsteps. In magnanimity, he will be as great as King Rantideva. And in religion, he will be like Maharaj Yayati.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verse from Srimad Bhagavatam (1.12.24) that will be discussed, focusing on the qualities predicted for Parikshit.

segments.key_quote: The brahmanas are describing this child is going to grow up to be a great devotee, a pure devotee of the Lord, and he'll have wonderful qualities.
segments.summary: The speaker explains the context of the verse, describing the inquiry of Maharaj Yudhishthira and the brahmanas' response about Parikshit's future qualities.

segments.key_quote: Sarva dharman parityajya mam ekam sharanam vraja.
segments.summary: The speaker quotes Srila Prabhupada's explanation of Krishna's final instruction in the Bhagavad Gita, emphasizing the importance of surrendering to Krishna and the difference between intelligent and less intelligent people in following this instruction.

segments.key_quote: Association is the cause of acquiring qualities.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the importance of association for acquiring good qualities, highlighting that pure devotees and the Supreme Lord possess all good qualities.

segments.key_quote: Association with fire makes an object hot.
segments.summary: The speaker uses the analogy of fire to explain how association with Krishna leads to acquiring His qualities, mentioning that a jiva can attain 78% of the Lord's godly qualities through intimate association.

segments.key_quote: To follow the instructions of the Lord means to associate with the Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that following the instructions of the Lord is equivalent to associating with Him due to the absolute nature of the Lord and His instructions (Advayagyana).

segments.key_quote: The Lord is present everywhere and at all times.
segments.summary: The speaker clarifies that associating with Krishna is not about physical contact but about understanding His transcendental nature and omnipresence.

segments.key_quote: The Lord can be present everywhere simultaneously.
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts the limited presence of jivas with the Lord's omnipresence as Brahman and Paramatma, reiterating that association with Him is possible by following His instructions.

segments.key_quote: Maharaj Parikshit associated with the Lord even from the womb of his mother up to the last day of his valuable life.
segments.summary: The speaker returns to the topic of Parikshit, explaining how his association with Krishna began in the womb when Krishna saved him from the Brahmastra.

segments.key_quote: Even though I am equal to everyone, but I am specially inclined to my pure devotees.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by emphasizing Krishna's special interest in His devotees and how Parikshit continued to associate with Krishna until the end of his life, ultimately acquiring all good qualities, ending with Hare Krishna.
